5085975.majtheme: Public sector governance,Financial and private sector development,Economic management

repnme.cdata!: Russia - Third Structural Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Structural Adjustment Loan
            (SAL3) will support economy-wide structural reforms that a)
            advance competitive enterprise and market development and
            impose financial discipline on the enterprise sector; and b)
            have a major direct impact on macroeconomic stability. It
            will focus on fiscal management reform, private sector
            development, reform of infrastructure monopolies, and
            banking reforms. The loan will encourage and enable the
            federal government to proceed with key structural reforms to
            sustain macroeconomic stability and stimulate renewed
            growth. The low-cost, non-inflationary budget financing
            provided will confer financial savings as well as economic
            benefits. The reforms supported will increase efficiency
            across a range of sectors by helping create a more
            competitive and open private sector-oriented economy. The
            risk of macroeconomic instability has been addressed through
            the operation's strong fiscal management measures, the
            resources it will provide to the economy, and through
            coordinating closely with the International Monetary
            Fund's ongoing Extended Fund Facility program. The risk
            of erratic commitment to reforms has been addressed by
            designing SAL3 based on strong prior actions and
            incorporating three progressive tranches. The risk of
            inadequate implementation of the reforms will be addressed
            through intensive supervision.
